junk.description: Wrong ingredients in.  Junk come out.  If only you used the Recipedia...

food.description: A bulbous protein rich berry.  Clever monkeys can cook it into almost any yummy delicacy.

wood.description: Once, the living trunk of a majestic tree.  Now dead.

water.description: Cool clear pond water.  Scum free!

stone.description: Rough stone from a local mountain.

barrel.description: Stout and full of water. You can shoot fish in it.

oak.description: A hard wood that has lived a hard life.  Misses its baby acorns.

bread.description: Fresh, hot loafs right out of the oven.  Try slices dribbled with honey and melted butter.

bricks.description: The finest red clay bricks this side of Greater Flandon.

spirits.description: Distilled berries yield a harsh liquor that puts hair in places you really don't want hair.

lumber.description: Planks hand-planed by an elderly master craftsman.  Each wood shaving is so fine you can see the sunset shine through.

perfume.description: Dab a little of this under your chin and the flan come runnin'

gems.description: Sparkly bits of glitter cut with a water wheel.

stew.description: Savory stew made from roots, sausage and your mother's soupy secrets. The steam fogs your glasses.

ore.description: Fractured stone under great heat reveals a metallic core. Ore! Go forth and forge a vast industry!

spices.description: The nubby petals, when ground in a Flannish mortar, produce a red powder that sets the senses aflame.

glass.description: Twelve parts sand, three parts trona, two parts lime. Brought to a bubble and then made into church windows.

cookedfood.description: The home cooked meal you miss so much.

flour.description: A white fruit-based flour used for baking.  Also fun to jump into and pretend you are a ghost.

mana.description: Food of the gods.  The gods unfortunately were machines, so consuming mana tends to make one's tongue blister.

mulledwine.description: An intoxicating staple of winter nights spent with friends 'round a table full of food and song.

shrines.description: Items of worship mass produced for mass.

potionofdeath.description: A poisonous beverage favored by ex-lovers and spiteful goldfish owners.

potionofjoy.description: Love in a bottle.  Sold in bulk to certified therapists.

potionoflife.description: Each flask contains a guaranteed five additional minutes of life.  Drink slowly to avoid exploding.

jewelry.description: These baubles cling to the curve of your breast.

idols.description: Small statuettes that contain a false bottom for hiding sacrilegious items.

gunpowder.description: A black powder used in fireworks and other celebratory activities. Like the upcoming purge of the Queen's enemies.

onyx.description: A banded variety of chalcedony.  Ha! You are now smarter than your brother.

jade.description: A green stone that reminds this scholar of your aunt's eyes on that summer dawn.

opal.description: A shimmering gem of many colors.  This one happens to be of the rare non-Australian variety

amber.description: Fossilized sap. Occasionally pieces contain dead bugs and eternal memories.

silver.description: A metal that is deeply jealous of gold and all the love it gets.  Sometimes found crying itself to sleep.

diamond.description: Diamonds are what happens when you squeeze a tree really tightly. Quite rare due to the Purge of the Tree Squeezers in 40 AD.

sapphire.description: A diamond dipped in blue dye

ruby.description: Long ago jewelers sacrificed miniature goats to turn stones red. If you hold a ruby up to your ear, you just might be able to hear the bleating.

rings.description: A band wrought of precious materials.  It speaks of a promise not always kept.

necklace.description: Necklaces are armor that lay bare our humdrum visage when removed.  Invaluable.

shields.description: A polished shield perfect for hanging on walls in order to pretend that you are manly.

hammers.description: Long of shaft and thick of head, these are not intended to be used on drums. The drum maker is very angry.

swords.description: Snicker snack!  A blade capable of severing a variety of cheeses and cutlets when one feels peckish.

sceptre.description: Princes collect scepters much as your or I might collect shoes.

amulet.description: Protection from spirits and hauntings.  It never seems to work out as promised in the literature.

crowns.description: The heavy burden of leadership built to rest upon a furrowed brow.

largebarrel.description: When a standard sized barrel just isn't enough.

blackoak.description: The oak preferred by pirates and brigands.

blackbread.description: A dense loaf traditionally consumed by soaking in stout

firedbricks.description: An upscale brick for rich folks that look down on red bricks as plebian.

whiskey.description: Aged to maturity in artisanal black oak barrels, a single sip will burn your socks off.

jewelrybox.description: The lock on the intricate box promises more than the costume jewelry.

desk.description: This classic desk was popularized in the Elder Puddingham era.  No assembly required because flan are not (and never will be) Swedish.

rockhammers.description: Hammer for bashing rock. Used by the workers to the east that lost their jobs and families to the illness with no cure.

fruitcake.description: Sometimes we give bad gifts because we care too much to give fragile feeling form.

cinnamonrolls.description: My fingers are so sticky. Are your fingers sticky too?  Even If you lick them, they don't stop being sticky.

catstatue.description: This was once a real cat, but then it was soaked in a special varnish. Now you can pet Fluffy forever.

metalingot.description: The poor sell their fillings to be melted into ingots

curry.description: 'The only way to enjoy spicy food is on the way in' -Flannish proverb

chowder.description: This was the meal that the fisherman ate the night before he was lost at sea.

grog.description: A seafarer's concoction made of weak beer, rum and a dash of lemon to chase off the scurvy.

chili.description: A hearty southern meal made from beans and locals that did not pay their royal taxes.

windows.description: An outdated product whose rudderless inventor is likely to go bankrupt in the next decade.

spyglass.description: In a well ordered society, it is a neighbor's duty to report unseemly details with great gusto.  The spyglass is merely a facilitator.

finebrandy.description: Now that cigars are banned in public places, consumption of brandy has doubled.

crockpot.description: All good moments in life can be slowly stewed in a crockpot.  Lift the lid, inhale and remember everything.

luxuryfood.description: The sort of plated meal a well off bachelor orders when attempting to impress an ingenue

glue.description: Sniffless and extremely capable of non-emotional bonding.

Firebread.description: Baked by lighting a tiny fire inside a bread crust cavity.  Eaten by families on Saturday nights.

FineFlour.description: When cooking pastries only the silkiest baking flour will prevent the chef from smacking you and yelling 'Dolt!'

sweetwine.description: Wine bewitched with the sweet tears of mispent youth.

rowboat.description: 'This stealthy rowboat is surprisingly useful if you need to get rid of a body.' Sales brochure, selling point #3.

haircream.description: The simple fact that you do not possess this amazing hair-styling product explains everything that has gone wrong with your life.

firering.description: A ring of fire.  It burns, burns, burns.

poisonring.description: When slipped upon a finger, a single twist releases a venom that makes you appear dead for 12 hours.

stonering.description: The sort of thing an insecure man wears in order to pretend that they aren't wearing jewelry.

firenecklace.description: Traditional dress of the high governors that stoke the fire tower flames.

poisonnecklace.description: All you need to do is hug your victim.  Please observe that the needles face outward.

stonenecklace.description: Recommended fashion for thick necked individuals with sloping shoulders.

crystalshield.description: A shield you can hide behind and still see where you are going.  Two handed

spiritshield.description: A shield imbued with expensive cantrips to block the ghost of your mother from seeing what you are doing with your life.

stealthshield.description: This shield doesn't clank about like all the other shields.  Stupid clanking shields.

icebarrel.description: Don't limit yourself to a simple ice bucket.  You are better than that.

sweetbread.description: Not actually bread.  And if it is indeed sweet, you picked a bad one.

porcelain.description: An essential religious altar during those fuzzy college years.

ice.description: A little bundle of chilled evil.  Don't let it escape.

finelumber.description: Those with a friend who is into carpentry, should give this as a present

breadpudding.description: Behold. Light cream drizzled over warm breadpudding.  Heaven awaits.

pottery.description: A child, age 5, broke the last one.  Replica pottery ensures that his step-father will never find out.

stoutbarrel.description: This barrel prefers the term 'stout'  over diminutive titles like 'tiny' or 'dwarven'

blackwhiskey.description: Duke Elba sold his soul to the Ice Witch for one stiff drink. This is what he quaffed.

ironrations.description: The last warriors of the Flannish took these rations on their suicide mission to vanquish the spirit lords.  There are no more warrior flan.

prayerstones.description: Yes, these prayer stones are made of foam, but it is certified blessed foam.

stewbarrel.description: This is what happens when you cook a barrel of monkeys

deathpowder.description: Produced by crushing dried mushrooms into powder.  A single pinch can aphyxiate a room.

heartymeals.description: A meal for flan that require two seats when traveling coach.

flatbread.description: The famous chef Rotoschooni made this dish for the Princess when he first cooked for her.  They eloped that night.

dullamulet.description: An amulet for the flan that does not need to flaunt their immense wealth.

dullsceptre.description: On the backside of this nondescript scepter is a spout that dispenses black whiskey.

dullcrown.description: The dour workers of the stony west fear reflections so they scuff their metal and break all foreign mirrors.

potionofundeath.description: Ha!  Juliet so wished she had this in that fine scene.

float.description: Carry on.  Nothing to see here.

wineofdeath.description: The distributor doesn't understand why this product sells so poorly.

wineofjoy.description: Actual just standard wine, but the packaging sells it.

gunship.description: Row, row, row your boat...BGOM!  Cannonball.

hairelixir.description: You can put this on your tongue and pretend you have a beard.

glowingamulet.description: The reverse of this pendant states 'In times of need, seek the glow of friends'

glowingsceptre.description: An inscription on the side of the scepter reads 'By working together, greatness is inevitable'

glowingcrown.description: Glowing words ring the band, spelling out 'Alone, you are nothing.'

shadowamulet.description: Minions sworn to the creeping ice wear such amulet to keep the heat of love at bay.

shadowsceptre.description: The first of the ice lords created this vile device from an inky pool of bitterness.

shadowcrown.description: If you ever stumble upon a shadow crown, burn it with fire.  The world hangs in balance.

woodbust.description: Even the teeth are wood. Wait! Those are my teeth!

porcelainbust.description: When you grow older, you'll collect a full glass case of these.

icestatue.description: Amelia Plumson, an artist of great renown, died. Her last wish was to send a last message.  This melting statue was found on her daughter's doorstep.

woodstatue.description: The sculptor of this carving was inspired by a time when he was lost in the subway.  A lady with ladybug boots gave him an apple and led him home.

chocolatestatue.description: All good things are made of chocolate.

porcelainstatue.description: The nation came together to create this great work.  The pride you feel comes from the bonds you built.

birthdaycake.description: Another year, another cake, another tube of toothpaste.

magicbuns.description: Magic Buns.  You just wanna squeeze 'em.

dullearrings.description: Made of lead.  Proudly sold in America

glowingearrings.description: There is a small switch in the back that makes these blink.  SOS!

shadowearrings.description: If you wear your hair down, no one will see these.  Your little secret.  That and the location of the bloody ax.

glowingshield.description: Friends shield us from loneliness like children shield politicians

absinthe.description: No one knows the secret hallucinagenic ingredients of this madman's liquor.

stickybuns.description: If children eat this treat with their fingers, they gain the magical ability to climb walls. While giggling maniacly.

pinkflamingo.description: Looks so much better than a mana orb.  Dear neighbor, "How about them apples?"

sundial.description: Time, like a rampaging herd of wild stallions, leaves behind an amazing quantity of poop.

hammeroftime.description: Stop. Hammered by time. Break me down.

sparkypants.description: If you must one day put on some pants...make them sparky pants

dullarmor.description: Hide from the world inside this tiny dull space.  No one can poke you now.

glowingarmor.description: Every person who loves you (or your luxuriant hair) decreases your AC by 1.

shadowarmor.description: This is the stuff that makes evil robots impervious to bullets.

bracelet.description: Elegance is a small band that accents the sweet bones of the youthful wrist.

bangle.description: A large rigid bracelet with Egyptian markings

armparty.description: Past a certain age, it is wise to trade elegance for "Hey, stop looking at my wrinkles."

writofseduction.description: A warrior of modern romance knows that the True Love sometimes needs a small kick forward.

glowingstatue.description: My loved one died.  Please remember her.

crownedstatue.description: The carved crown was so stunning that his people remembered him as a hero, not a drunk.

blackheart.description: The shriveled heart of a flan that did not play nicely with others
